alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 3:49PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following county, Humphreys. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 348 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain and very high rainfall rates due to thunderstorms moving slowly southeastward across Humphreys County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have already fallen in the past hour northwest of Waverly. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waverly, Camden and New Johnsonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
